13.title: Hit or Miss
13.plot: Eugene and Spencer salvage a rusted Winchester M37 and an antique diesel engine from a barn full of scrap.

21.title: Underwater Ghost Town Part 1
21.plot: Eugene and Spencer run out of vintage high carbon steel, for forging knives to fill an important order. Can they build a salvage barge from junk, to seek a lost sawmill in an abandoned underwater town, and retrieve the old steel that was left behind?

22.title: Underwater Ghost Town Part 2
22.plot: Eugene and Spencer need to turn a riding mower engine into an outboard motor strong enough to power a salvage barge. The boys want it to locate a lost sawmill in an abandoned underwater town, where they hope to retrieve any vintage steel left behind.

1.title: Moonshining Secrets
1.plot: Eugene and Spencer go on a mission to track down a mystery moonshiner who has overtaken Eugene's spot as top bootlegger in the holler and learn his secrets to a better brew. In the process, they'll have to brave freezing rivers and disarm a deadfall trap.

2.title: Church and Snake
2.plot: Doing their part to keep mountain traditions alive, Spencer and Eugene help a local preacher in need of snakes for a Pentecostal church service. A dangerous assignment, especially in winter, they need to devise gadgets to protect themselves and any snake

3.title: Sucken Treasure
3.plot: Spencer and Eugene concoct a home made pontoon barge and diving gear to retrieve submerged old growth logs. They'll risk life and limb diving into the frigid lake.

4.title: Hillbilly Tow
4.plot: Spencer and Eugene go out on a limb to extract a rare 1940s Willys jeep abandoned in the forest. They'll cut down a two-ton tree to help free the jeep from its precarious perch. If the tree falls the wrong way, it could destroy the jeep and kill the boys

5.title: Mine Full of Gems
5.plot: If the boys can repair a decrepit garnet mine, they stand to uncover a treasure trove of gems. But nothing comes easy for these mountain men. They trek across dangerously muddy roads and risk being buried alive if their hillbilly engineering can't hold.

6.title: Apple Jack
6.plot: Making Apple Jack liquor turns out to be almost more than Spencer and Eugene bargained for. Everything from turning a shed into a root cellar, freak storms and faulty equipment could stop them in their tracks. Their hillbilly gumption sees them through.

7.title: A Fishy Trade
7.plot: Eugene and Spencer trade fish for a fridge to make a smoker. While the fish smokes, they look for specific holly leaves to make Black Drink, a coffee substitute. Similar leaves are poisonous, so it's imperative they pick the right plant.

8.title: Tom-A-Hawg
8.plot: The local blacksmith enlists Spencer and Eugene to fix his broken pigpen in exchange for lard and pork.Their challenge is to concoct a battery-powered welder, but even with this helpful contraption Spencer breaks his precious tomahawk axe.

9.title: Survival of the Fittest
9.plot: Spencer and Eugene are forced off a blocked road into the woods while delivering medicine. With no provisions, Spencer plants a fish trap, but falls into a freezing stream. Eugene quickly makes an insulated coat for him out of grass.

10.title: Hillbilly Prepper
10.plot: Eugene decides to build a "gassifer," which will create electricity when other power systems fail. But building a sophisticated machine like this out of scrapyard parts is not easy and could cause a serious explosion.

11.title: Waste Not, Want Not
11.plot: It's winter and firewood is scarce. Spencer and Eugene need firewood fast, but without a serious log splitter, it will take the boys forever to chop it up. Eugene devises a wild contraption he makes at the blacksmith's shop.

12.title: Hillbilly BBQ
12.plot: Eugene and Spencer are enlisted into taking over the holler's annual hoedown. The boys have only two days to concoct a giant grill large enough to feed the entire community, make homemade wood charcoal, plus a stage for the band out of shipping pallets.

1.title: Legend of Lost Creek Gold
1.plot: Spencer and Eugene hunt for gold with their friend Cowboy. They'll create a hillbilly rickshaw to carry him through the hills. Then they'll have to brave freezing water if they want to suction out gold from the river-bed with their homemade dredger!

2.title: Green Gold
2.plot: The boys must harvest half a pound of ginseng to trade for Eugene's truck down payment. But a poacher is getting in their way. It's a race against time to track him down and find a way to get these roots dried, all before that truck gets sold.

3.title: Raise the Roof
3.plot: Spencer and Eugene must rig up a post and scaffold system to yank a 1,300 pound tin roof off an old smokehouse to cover Spencer's outdoor forge to keep their knife-making business going all winter.

4.title: Pigskin Payout
4.plot: Spencer and Eugene's friend Ben's stash of meat is savaged by wild critters. They offer to turn the tainted meat into biodiesel, so Ben can barter it for fresh farm meat. If the homemade fuel isn't perfect, it'll ruin the farmer's tractor!

5.title: Stump Grinder
5.plot: The boys are on an urgent mission to remove tree stumps for their widowed neighbor. When their homemade motorcycle stump grinder fails, they have to resort to plan B: blowing up the stumps with explosives made from bat droppings.

6.title: Good Ole Knife Fight
6.plot: Spencer and Eugene's knife-making business is jeopardized when a stranger to the holler brings a cheaper blade into the local market. They're forced into a competition to see who can make the best knife.

7.title: Cowpie Heater
7.plot: Eugene's electric water heater keeps breaking, so he and Spencer design a replacement that runs on manure, a.k.a. cow pies. But even if local ranchers are willing to share this rich fuel source, the boys' homemade heater must burn clean enough, or his house will smell like a cowpie.

8.title: Huntin' Treehouse
8.plot: If the local hunt club likes a tree stand Eugene and Spencer build, they'll be allowed to hunt on their private land. With hunting season a day away, can the boys use their hand-milled lumber, waterproofing from homemade birch oil, and abandoned pigsty roofing to build the stand in time?

9.title: Cold Mountain Power
9.plot: When Spencer hears that the fire chief wants to equip his squad with Cold Mountain-made tools, he and Eugene salvage a steel saw blade from the big scrapyard, and get to work forging a bushwhacking brush clearing machete from it, to win the contract.

10.title: Hillbilly Bunker
10.plot: Eugene and Spencer make a secret bug-out shelter using an abandoned dynamite cabinet. Can they trust someone to help them bury this structure, and rig it up with a system to provide fresh water? Will attaching this apparatus to the bunker as it's being buried prove to be too dangerous?

12.title: Hillbilly Vodka
12.plot: Eugene and Spencer make Hillbilly Vodka for Eugene's mom from potatoes a farmer gives them. They use Spencer's truck like a giant blender to smash the potatoes for mash, and build an insulated hay house to store the extras. The boys trek to Grandpa's mountain cave to make their brew.

13.title: Lincoln Logs
13.plot: When a dying hemlock tree threatens to topple over onto Spencer's forge, Eugene makes a plan for bringing the giant tree down safely, and then for using the 500-pound logs to build a valuable drying shed that will help Spencer grow his herb business.

14.title: Cowboy ATV
14.plot: Cowboy can't get around like he used to, so when the spring ramps sprout, he asks Spencer and Eugene to build him an all-terrain four-wheeler that will take him to his favorite ramp patches no matter how steep the spot they grow, up on Cold Mountain.

15.title: Mountain Machete
15.plot: Word gets to Spencer that the fire chief wants to equip his squad with tools made on Cold Mountain, so he and Eugene get to work trying to win the contract by forging a bushwhacking, brush-clearing machete from a steel saw blade they salvaged from a big scrapyard.

16.title: Hillbilly Houseboat
16.plot: Spencer and Eugene make a hillbilly houseboat by mounting an old camper onto barrels and attaching a lawnmower-powered paddle wheel to the contraption, which they take to the lake for a test run.

17.title: Hot Mama
17.plot: Eugene and Spencer build an air conditioner, for Mama Gene's car, from an old fan and wet rags. But when they use deadly materials to build a house-sized chiller, will it all blow up in their faces?

20.title: 4th of July
20.plot: Mama Gene steps in a gopher hole and breaks her foot, leaving her homebound on the porch. She's plagued by insects, and missing out on the 4th of July festivities. So the boys build her a flame roasting bug zapper, and a hillbilly ninja rocket wheel.

1.title: Cowboy Prepper
1.plot: Cowboy is sure that end days are on the way, so he asks Eugene and Spencer to fortify his compound. The boys construct a wood still for converting wood matter into fuel, out of an old barrel, some buckets and pipes, so Cowboy has fuel no matter what.

2.title: Treasure Hunt
2.plot: Cowboy convinces Eugene and Spencer to embark on an expedition for gold, but they encounter an interloper who threatens to steal their treasure.

3.title: Chainsaw Chopper
3.plot: Eugene and Spencer decide to build a solar-powered hot water heater out of salvaged pipes and old beer cans, but first they need to construct a chainsaw chopper for their friend who has the supplies they need.

4.title: Legend of Trapper Dan
4.plot: The boys uncover clues that may lead to treasure. Eugene constructs a metal detector out of bamboo and wire scraps, and a salvaged transistor radio. Because finding the location is one problem, but uncovering the treasure once they arrive is another.

5.title: Hillbeely Hive
5.plot: The guys save a friend's home from a honeybee swarm, and decide to start their own honey-making business.

6.title: Walkin' Sticks and Chicken Spits
6.plot: The boys build a wood kiln and a huge outdoor rotisserie for cooking chickens, out of discarded oil barrels and a mattress frame.

7.title: Water War
7.plot: If Eugene and Spencer want to resolve a water feud and save Cowboy's crops they must build a trickle-feed irrigation system from a pile of bamboo and some scrap metal that they scrounge. It'll take a little muscle and all their wits to heal the feud.

8.title: Hillbilly Log Home
8.plot: The boys transform a herb-drying shed into a guest house cabin for Spencer's visiting mother-in-law.

9.title: Appalachian Burls
9.plot: When Eugene breaks his mom's rare burl wood bowl, he and Spencer must cut down a giant burl, forge woodworking tools from scrap metal, and repair an old truck just to use the axle as a wood lathe, for turning their burl into a new bowl for Mama Gene.

10.title: Backwoods Rope Bridge
10.plot: A creek blocks the best route from Cowboy's house to the holler, so Eugene and Spencer build an old fashion swinging bridge from scavenged rope and hand-hewn bamboo. Will their hillbilly rope bridge hold weight? Or will it dump the boys in the drink?

11.title: Monster Mower
11.plot: Eugene and Spencer aim to clear an overgrown field and find a valuable item Cowboy hid there years ago. But their hand-made brush axes can't cut the dense growth, so the boys build a brush hog out of Cowboy's old truck and a couple of used lawn mowers.

15.title: Car Bartering
15.plot: Widowed Mavis has doctor appointments to keep, and a stalled car. If the boys make a tire patch, a replacement gasket and a temporary fan belt out of junk, then they get an old alternator from a junkyard, they might get Mavis to the doctor on time.

16.title: Catfish Catchin'
16.plot: Spencer and Eugene must build their own hillbilly houseboat, out of a discarded camping trailer, which they float on a pontoon platform made with rows of airtight oil drums, when Cheyenne gets a leisure boat and becomes a bit too big for his britches.

17.title: Mountain Swapping
17.plot: Spencer and Eugene must build a barn wood display case for Cheyenne's store. But to get the wood they must make traps to catch a critter, to make into groundhog grease, to trade for a dog, which they can trade for barn wood to finally make the case.

18.title: Fishy Business
18.plot: Spencer and Eugene set out to build a fish farm. But when they can't afford the cattle-watering troughs where they planed to put their trout, can they rig up their own fish tanks from nothing but a roll of plastic tarp and some old hay bales instead?

19.title: Risky Railroads
19.plot: Eugene and Spencer plan to build wood-burning stoves out of steel barrels, with windows made of high-quality block mica. Can they also build a hand-powered pump trolley out of junkyard scraps for bringing heavy sacks of mica down from the mountains?

-1.title: Knife Grind
-1.plot: Spencer and Eugene have two days to forge 15 knives for a collector. The boys construct a water wheel to power a homemade hydro-powered grinder-and to power an electric light. Because if they want to meet that deadline, they must pull an all-nighter.

imdb.plot outline: The boys use their Hillbilly smarts to search for a lost creek filled with gold and create their own dredger to retrieve the treasure. They also use their hillbilly engineering skills to make a water-wheel-powered dehydrator out of junk, and to move a tin roof.
imdb.title: Hillbilly Blood
plot: The boys use their Hillbilly smarts to search for a lost creek filled with gold and create their own dredger to retrieve the treasure. They also use their hillbilly engineering skills to make a water-wheel-powered dehydrator out of junk, and to move a tin roof.
